snippet.textDisplay: I find it hilarious that the rising trend in PC gaming through the last generation inspired a console that's basically an mITX pc. lmfao Great work from Microsoft this time around, in all seriousness. This makes me Want to have a console alongside my pc. On top of that the performance sounds pretty damn good. I'm excited to hear that consoles might actually get a half decent GPU for once and with RTX? Now that's impressive! They're really trying to bridge the gap of pc vs xbox gaming and all it's missing is the ability to run Windows. Sony has a high fucking bar to meet, I'm sure they won't even reach it, not this time.
snippet.textOriginal: I find it hilarious that the rising trend in PC gaming through the last generation inspired a console that's basically an mITX pc. lmfao Great work from Microsoft this time around, in all seriousness. This makes me Want to have a console alongside my pc. On top of that the performance sounds pretty damn good. I'm excited to hear that consoles might actually get a half decent GPU for once and with RTX? Now that's impressive! They're really trying to bridge the gap of pc vs xbox gaming and all it's missing is the ability to run Windows. Sony has a high fucking bar to meet, I'm sure they won't even reach it, not this time.

snippet.textDisplay:
You want to know who'd play the xbox series x in a desert? People like me, who live in a desert. The US Southwest (and northwest part of Mexico) is a very hot, dusty, and dry place. And sometimes the AC isn't the best at its job. So, yeah. And that's just in North America, Microsoft's back yard. Think about the other places around the world where there are cities in the desert.


Stupid question to ask, "Who'd play the xbox in a desert."
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: $100 for a 1TB flash drive/memory card isn't all that expensive when you think back to the previous generations of consoles with expandable memory. I mean, do you all remember the 4GB Xbox 360 Slim? You literally couldn't run anything on it without something giving you more memory, and a 250GB insertable HDD was dropped on the market at around $130 if I'm not mistaken. But regardless, as time goes on, games keep getting bigger in file size and hardware/memory capabilities gotta ramp up in response. Thankfully, pricing these needed 'upgrades' has remained mildly reasonable.
snippet.textOriginal: $100 for a 1TB flash drive/memory card isn't all that expensive when you think back to the previous generations of consoles with expandable memory. I mean, do you all remember the 4GB Xbox 360 Slim? You literally couldn't run anything on it without *something* giving you more memory, and a 250GB insertable HDD was dropped on the market at around $130 if I'm not mistaken. But regardless, as time goes on, games keep getting bigger in file size and hardware/memory capabilities gotta ramp up in response. Thankfully, pricing these needed 'upgrades' has remained mildly reasonable.

snippet.textDisplay: Am i only one who doesn't care for consoles, anymore. The last console i cared about was PS2. Then i got a PC and never looked back. You you wanna game on consoles, be my guest. But the PC is where it's at for me. It's not just about the hardware, for me PC is king also because of emulation. Emulating PS2 games on PCSX2 emulator in 2k resolution or more is amazing. Not to mention using hacks to unlock playing some of them at 60 fps. The same is already possible with some Wii U games on Cemu as well as some switch games on Yuzu emulator. As well as RPCS3 emulator. Then there are various mods for all kinds of games, as well as DRM free games (GOG.com) etc...The new consoles must be capable of running games at 1080p and 60 fps at all times, minimum.
snippet.textOriginal: Am i only one who doesn't care for consoles, anymore. The last console i cared about was PS2. Then i got a PC and never looked back. You you wanna game on consoles, be my guest. But the PC is where it's at for me. It's not just about the hardware, for me PC is king also because of emulation. Emulating PS2 games on PCSX2 emulator in 2k resolution or more is amazing. Not to mention using hacks to unlock playing some of them at 60 fps. The same is already possible with some Wii U games on Cemu as well as some switch games on Yuzu emulator. As well as RPCS3 emulator. Then there are various mods for all kinds of games, as well as DRM free games (GOG.com) etc...The new consoles must be capable of running games at 1080p and 60 fps at all times, minimum.

snippet.textDisplay: Did you guys happen to catch any power figures? I'm hinting at TDP but I realize that MS might not share that sort of thing, so power consumption would suffice. I mean even with the savings from TSMC N7P, going from 40/36 with the 5700 (XT) to 52 CUs (and at 1825mhz at that) is a big jump. Definitely not staying below 200W though, I know that much. Look at the size of that heatsink!
snippet.textOriginal: Did you guys happen to catch any power figures? I'm hinting at TDP but I realize that MS might not share that sort of thing, so power consumption would suffice. I mean even with the savings from TSMC N7P, going from 40/36 with the 5700 (XT) to 52 CUs (and at 1825mhz at that) is a big jump. Definitely not staying below 200W though, I know that much. Look at the size of that heatsink!

snippet.authorDisplayName: Speak out and remove all doubt!
snippet.textDisplay:
Did they say why they are showing so much (everything) off in mid March? Just seems a very odd move to do it so early as not many will be able to stay hyped for the next 30+ weeks. So why are they showing their hand so early on?
It doesn't even matter if it's because they believe/know Sony can't beat it, as it seems to beat themselves from a marketing standpoint as like I said the excitement will be lost on most by next week let alone in 8 months!
snippet.textOriginal:
Did they say why they are showing so much (everything) off in mid March? Just seems a very odd move to do it so early as not many will be able to stay hyped for the next 30+ weeks. So why are they showing their hand so early on? 
It doesn't even matter if it's because they believe/know Sony can't beat it, as it seems to beat themselves from a marketing standpoint as like I said the excitement will be lost on most by next week let alone in 8 months!

snippet.textDisplay:
Microsoft are so on point.

I have all consoles. PS4 has incredible exclusives and i love them, but i feel that is all it has currently. Exclusives are not enough to hold the top spot of a games console. My Xbox One X simply runs every other game (third party) better. It feels like every third party game is exclusive to the Xbox One X because it just simply plays subjectively better and looks better, not just stats. Therefore Xbox One X naturally is my primary console. It also runs home media systems like Plex way better and a more diverse online presence, so it’s an easy win for me as it’s my Xbox (All-in) One X. Backwards compatibility is also extremely important and if Sony doesn’t do it, again (In short they said “not many actually play them and they look ancient, so like why would anyone play this?!”), and not just “most” PS4 titles then they will always be far behind the development and evolution of the gaming industry.

If Microsoft delivers and Sony just releases more exclusives, then although I’m sure the PS5 will do just fine, Sony will lose respect from the gaming community as it already is and may start a gradual decline. It seems as though Microsoft has left Sony behind and they are in two different leagues now, Sony in the traditional and Microsoft in the evolutionary. It sounds painful to say but Sony kind of feels like Nintendo now, but let’s see what they have to offer as well soon.

Great video as always DF!
snippet.textOriginal:
Microsoft are so on point.

I have all consoles. PS4 has incredible exclusives and i love them, but i feel that is all it has currently. Exclusives are not enough to hold the top spot of a games console. My Xbox One X simply runs every other game (third party) better. It feels like every third party game is exclusive to the Xbox One X because it just simply plays subjectively better and looks better, not just stats. Therefore Xbox One X naturally is my primary console. It also runs home media systems like Plex way better and a more diverse online presence, so it’s an easy win for me as it’s my Xbox (All-in) One X. Backwards compatibility is also extremely important and if Sony doesn’t do it, again (In short they said “not many actually play them and they look ancient, so like why would anyone play this?!”), and not just “most” PS4 titles then they will always be far behind the development and evolution of the gaming industry.

If Microsoft delivers and Sony just releases more exclusives, then although I’m sure the PS5 will do just fine, Sony will lose respect from the gaming community as it already is and may start a gradual decline. It seems as though Microsoft has left Sony behind and they are in two different leagues now, Sony in the traditional and Microsoft in the evolutionary. It sounds painful to say but Sony kind of feels like Nintendo now, but let’s see what they have to offer as well soon.

Great video as always DF!

snippet.textDisplay:
can u change the menu of the xsx more similar to the xbox360? to make the avatar and friends more visible?
probably nobody cares, but 11 years ago I bought the xbox 360, the best console I've ever had, not because I was a small child, but because it really offered really incredible things, all my friends had it and that was the most incredible thing, besides the community, the personalization, in short, everything ...
When xbox one came to market, there were several errors that were made in its presentation, this made many people switch to PS4, then, the brand that I liked the most about consoles (xbox) was empty,
all my friends left this console, this family ...
It is sad to see my list of friends, all of us and to see that only I remain,

Please get the customers back, let's make this family great again

Blah blah blah the nvme design blah blah blah impressive.
No, not impressive. Remember ps vita.

Since that crt vídeo you guys seem to force something unto us, and something which is clearly not ok.

Not being able to put any vendor drive on it, something that has the specs is a no no and will lead to ms charging heaps on the drives.

But yeah let’s say Microsoft did that for compatibility.

snippet.textDisplay:
The specs are impressive! Even if I still think 9 seconds to load State of Decay is longer than I expected, but I was hyped for miracles lol

The propriety memory cards are a big negative so far, only allowing for 2tb of storage in total for games and having to wait to transfer other games from external HDD is gonna be a pain.

But otherwise I'm actually impressed by Microsoft so far! The backwards compatibility evolution for next gen is great too! I never though I'd think Xbox could be a success again! lol
snippet.textOriginal:
The specs are impressive! Even if I still think 9 seconds to load State of Decay is longer than I expected, but I was hyped for miracles lol

The propriety memory cards are a big negative so far, only allowing for 2tb of storage in total for games and having to wait to transfer other games from external HDD is gonna be a pain.

But otherwise I'm actually impressed by Microsoft so far! The backwards compatibility evolution for next gen is great too! I never though I'd think Xbox could be a success again! lol

snippet.textDisplay: The design of the 2013 Mac Pro was fantastic, but never really allowed the simple upgrading users wanted and got that the previous and proceeding versions have. But when you only have limited or very basic upgrades available for something like a home gaming console, that design starts making a lot better sense, and that's why I'd use the Series X to the '13 Mac Pro has the closest comparison in terms of design inspiration (albeit a lot more packed internals).
snippet.textOriginal: The design of the 2013 Mac Pro was fantastic, but never really allowed the simple upgrading users wanted and got that the previous and proceeding versions have. But when you only have limited or very basic upgrades available for something like a home gaming console, that design starts making a lot better sense, and that's why I'd use the Series X to the '13 Mac Pro has the closest comparison in terms of design inspiration (albeit a lot more packed internals).
